description:
Ref: parent epic bw-d5l, Phase 3.

Depends on Phase 2 (bw-d5l.2) — store injection must be in place so there's one store per invocation.

1. Add `cache map[string]*Issue` field to Store struct.
2. readIssue: check cache first, return cached copy on hit. On miss, read from FS, populate cache, return.
3. writeIssue: write to FS first (preserving error semantics), then update cache on success.
4. Delete: after FS removal, evict from cache via delete(s.cache, id).
5. Add ClearCache() method that sets cache to nil. Call it after sync/rebase in the sync command.
6. All existing tests must pass unchanged — the cache is an internal optimization invisible to callers.
7. Add a targeted test: create an issue, read it twice, confirm only one FS read (or confirm cache hit via a second read returning the same pointer).
title: Add write-through cache to Store
